description: Removes the specified managed policy from the specified role.

unverifiedMitreAttackTechniques.reason: By detaching policies from roles, attackers can invalidate certain permissions, reducing the risk of detection while using compromised accounts.
By detaching policies, attackers can remove access permissions, disrupting legitimate user operations and evading detection.
Removing policies can be part of a strategy to clean up indicators of malicious activity on the account, aiding in defense evasion.
Detaching policies may impair security configurations, reducing the ability of the environment to detect or prevent further malicious activities.

securityImplications: Attackers might use DetachRolePolicy to remove crucial permissions from IAM roles, disrupting AWS services.
